meanings.definition: To draw into the mouth by contracting the muscles of the lips and mouth to make a partial vacuum.
meanings.sent1: The baby was sucking on her pacifier.
meanings.sent2: She was sucking on a straw to drink her juice.
meanings.sent3: The vacuum cleaner was sucking up all the dirt from the carpet.
meanings.sent4: The black hole was sucking in everything around it.
meanings.sent5: The vampire bat was sucking blood from its prey.

meanings.definition: To draw in or take up by absorption or suction.
meanings.sent1: The sponge was sucking up the spilled water.
meanings.sent2: The roots of the tree were sucking up nutrients from the soil.
meanings.sent3: The straw was sucking up the milkshake at a rapid pace.
meanings.sent4: The tornado was sucking in debris from the destroyed houses.
meanings.sent5: The vacuum cleaner was sucking up dust particles from the floor.

meanings.definition: To be very bad or unpleasant.
meanings.sent1: The movie was so bad, it felt like it was sucking the joy out of me.
meanings.sent2: The taste of the medicine was sucking all the sweetness from her mouth.
meanings.sent3: The rainy weather was sucking the fun out of the beach day.
meanings.sent4: The negative comments were sucking the enthusiasm from the team.
meanings.sent5: The long wait at the doctor's office was sucking the patience out of the child.
